intro: Acontias luridus, commonly known as the lurid leafhopper, is a small insect belonging to the family Cicadellidae. It is characterized by its bright, often colorful body that can range from yellow to orange and red. The plant it feeds on is typically a member of the grass family, where it pierces plant tissue to suck sap. Its wings are usually transparent or slightly veined, aiding in camouflage. This species is often found in open habitats such as fields and meadows, where it can easily blend with the vegetation.
